phoenix

Class media

  • java.lang.Object
    • phoenix.media

  • public final class media
extends java.lang.Object
    API Generated: Tue May 17 06:47:42 EDT 2016
    API Source: MediaAPI
    The MediaAPI is a set of API calls that will deal with getting information out of the IMediaFile and IMediaFolder objects.

    In time, we should have completely wrapped the SageTV MediaFileAPI. The reason is that we want to abstract the fact that we are dealing with sage tv media files, since we may not always be dealing with SageTV media files. For example, if a trailers application is written, they may provider a vfs implementation for there IMediaFile and IMediaFolder implementation and they would still work with these apis and be navigatable and playable via the UI

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      media()

    • Method Detail

      • GetFormattedTitle

        public static java.lang.String GetFormattedTitle(java.lang.Object mediaFile)
        Given the media file, return a formatted title. The title is formatted according to several different criteria. A title can have a title mask if it's a Recording, TV Show, Video or Multi-CD video.

        Title Masks are processed by the TextReplacement tool and masks can contain formatting instructions, based on MessageFormat, SimpleDateFormat, or DecimalFormat.

        Media Masks can be configured using the MediaConfiguration fields

        Parameters:
        mediaFile - IMediaFile or native SageTV media file object
        Returns:

      • GetSageMediaFile

        public static java.lang.Object GetSageMediaFile(java.lang.Object mediaFile)
        Given a mediaFile (or any type) return a native Sage MediaFile object. If the input is a sage media object, then it is returned. If it's not, then the object is converted into a sage media file, and then returned.
        Parameters:
        mediaFile -
        Returns:
        sage's native media object, or null if this is not a native sagetv mediafile

      • GetFileSystemMediaFile

        public static java.io.File GetFileSystemMediaFile(java.lang.Object mediaFile)
        Returns the FileSystem File object for this media file. In the event that there are multiple files, then only the first one is returned.
        Parameters:
        mediaFile - Sage MediaFile of VFS MediaFile
        Returns:
        File if one exists.

      • GetMediaResource

        public static IMediaResource GetMediaResource(java.lang.Object mediaFile)
        Given the mediafile return a IMediaResource. The media resource may be a file or folder. If the object is not a IMediaResource then it is converted into a IMediaResource and then returned.
        Parameters:
        mediaFile -
        Returns:

      • GetCount

        public static int GetCount(IMediaFolder folder)
        Safely gets the count of items in a Video Folder. For online videos this will NOT force the children to be loaded, and the size will return 0 if the files have not been loaded
        Parameters:
        folder -
        Returns:

      • IsType

        public static boolean IsType(IMediaResource imediaresource,
                             int type)
        One of the types listed MediaResourceType, or a custom type.

        An item can have multiple types. isType(FILE) should always return true for a MediaFile and isType(FOLDER) should always return true for a folder

        Parameters:
        type -
        Returns:
        true if the media resource is the given type

      • IsType

        public static boolean IsType(java.lang.Object imediaresource,
                             int type)
        Convenience method that will convert the incoming object parameter to a IMediaResource type using phoenix.media.GetMediaResource, and then allow the API call to work as intended on the resolved object.

      • Delete

        public static boolean Delete(IMediaResource imediaresource,
                             Hints hints)
        Deletes this resource, if it's able to be deleted

        You can pass a Hint of HINT_DELETE_WITH_PREJUDICE=true. It is up the implementation to determine if it will handle hints, etc.

        Return true if the resource was deleted

      • Accept

        public static void Accept(IMediaResource imediaresource,
                          IMediaResourceVisitor visitor,
                          IProgressMonitor monitor,
                          int deep)
        Visit this resource using the visitor and progress monitor. if the visitor returns true and the visitor has children, then those children will be traversed, so long as it does not surpass the 'deepness'.

        At any time the visiting can be stopped by setting the monitor to cancelled.

        An implementation should ensure that that monitor is never null.

        Passing 0 for deep ensures that only this item is visited. Passing 1 will ensure that this item plus any child elements will be visited.

        Parameters:
        visitor -
        monitor -
        deep - how many levels deep to traverse.

      • Accept

        public static void Accept(java.lang.Object imediaresource,
                          IMediaResourceVisitor visitor,
                          IProgressMonitor monitor,
                          int deep)
        Convenience method that will convert the incoming object parameter to a IMediaResource type using phoenix.media.GetMediaResource, and then allow the API call to work as intended on the resolved object.
